page.title: 06FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: Farming in the Area Most of the agriculture of this area is arable farming, although there is some permanent pasture around Wyberton where cows are kept and at Frampton where sheep are grazed. Most of the fields are large, have no hedges and there are few trees about. The fields are fenced or are bounded by drains, known locally as dykes. The water from the fields drain into these dykes and from them into bigger drains until it is finally pumped out into the river at one of the pumping stations. From there it is caried away into the sea. This is necessary because the land is very low. It was once marsh or fen and if it was not properly drained it would soon become flooded.
